etymologies: mid 17th century: from Dutch, from stoken ‘stoke a furnace’, from Middle Dutch stoken ‘push, poke’; related to stick

definitions: a person who tends the furnace on a steamship or steam locomotive.
shortDefinitions: person who tends furnace on steamship or steam train

definitions: a mechanical device for supplying fuel to a firebox or furnace, especially on a steam locomotive
shortDefinitions: mechanical device for supplying fuel to firebox or furnace
